text.section: After a public hearing, the Commission may declare an urban area a "real estate conservation area" if the Commission finds that the racial stability of the area is threatened by the volume of real estate transactions.

section.section: In determining whether to impose a suspension, the Commission shall base its determination on a preponderance of the evidence.

When determining whether to impose a suspension, the Commission shall provide information to the community affected, including:
the racial and economic composition of the real estate conservation area;
the number of real estate transactions in the area; and
the fair market values of properties affected.

A suspension under paragraph (1) of this subsection may not:
apply to advertising in regularly distributed newspapers, magazines, radio, television, or telephone directories; or
exceed 24 months in duration.

Subject to the provisions of this subsection, the Commission may:
modify a suspension;
remove a suspension; or
periodically renew a suspension for a period not exceeding 24 months.
In determining whether to modify, remove, or renew a suspension, the Commission shall follow the same requirements for originally imposing a suspension under subsection (b) of this section.

text.section: Any person aggrieved by a suspension may take an appeal to the circuit court of any county.
